intro: Guatteria polyantha, commonly known as the white-flowered guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Marcaceae and is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and clusters of fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that are typically eaten by various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
